review_blob: I just got back from my road trip from visalia to pick this up.  Aroma disappears after pouring.  Slight alcohol smell, nothing stands out.  Pours black with hardly any head.  Ive never tasted anything like this one.  Its hard to describe: Looks thin bodied, but tastes/feels full bodied; flavors of oak, raison, alcohol, malt, chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon.  Very very tasty.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: CARBONATED! That was my first response to opening this gem.  Partied this one with Lagunitasfan.  Aroma was yeasty and doughy.  A smooth overall drink, seemed well balanced and not too rich.  Tartness wasnt over the top, and I grew more and more disappointed as the glass slowly swallowed my beer.  Well done by my boy Tom (even though i havent met him).

22ozr shared with Tim (Lagunitasfan).  Cracked this one while Tim was on the phone talking to his brother.  Tim exclaimed, "That looks like motor oil!"  Pours with plenty of carbonation and weak lacing on glass.  Taste contains hardly any proof of barrel aging.  Didnt have an alcohol burn at all, an extremely smooth sipper.  Amazing brew recommended.
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Barrel Aged BORIS The Crusher

review_blob: 1L swingtop shared with myself.  Pours a deep maroon color with bubbly egg shell colored head.  Aroma is alcohol, raisin, and caramel.  Very warming beer, sits well with the cold weather.  Slight alcohol burn going down, with a strong malty/sugary finish.  Seems like it needs some age, but overall decent beer.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Pours murky/burnt orange.  Smell is pine and malty.  Taste is malt, sugar, and citrus.  The body was has a weird thickness to it.   A let down for me.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Pours hazy brown with tons of beige head.  Aroma is mainly coffee taste is prunes, chocolate and coffee beans.  Alcohol is hidden well with this one.  I need more of this great brew.
On Tap at City Beer:  Pours black with white head.  Nose is pine, hops, and chocolate.  Palate is just right, extremely easy drinking.  Hoppy makes me happy and this one made me happy.  Recommended.
beer_name: Stone Sublimely Self Righteous Black IPA

review_blob: On tap @ Toronado:  Golden color with white head.  Pretty thin on the palate and goes down somewhat dry.  Has some bread and yeast characters.  Decent beer.

On tap @ Toronado:  Pour is a dark brownish redish color.  Quarter in of white head.  Aroma is cherry warheads and alcohol.  Taste is smooth and extremely tart.  The first sip made my eyebrows quiver, but became easier after a few drinks.  Im not a sour guy, but this one is doable.  Solid.
Aroma is oat like, almost smells like a bowl of cheerios.  Taste is dry with flavors of yeast and wheat.  Very boring brew.  Next please

Had a nice Pfffft when cracked then almost zero head when poured.  Body is extremely thick and pours a rich brown color.  Taste is caramel and malt, but mainly raisons.  Not that great.  1999 vintage and you could tell......going downhill.

From  Lagunitasfan thanks homie.  Pours dark with a frothy tan head.  Taste is mainly coffee and a touch of vanilla notes on the aftertaste.  Great fuckin beer overall, probably the best Ive had from this brewery so far.  I really enjoyed it.

Yum, on tap in Tower.  Shared with my girl Amber who hated every drop of it.  What else is new?  Poured blacker than night with a nice quarter inch of tan head.  This is the 2008 10%abv version.  Nose is alcohol and malt.  Taste has both hints of coffee and chocolate, with subtle alcohol hints through out.  Really easy drinking and probably the best brew from sequoia so far.  Going back for more this weekend.  Funny sign on the wall as you walk in though it read:  "Russian Imperial Stout has a two pint limit..."  I wonder why?
Just ok.  Thin palate, and very dry going down.  Pours amber, nose is carmel and stinging hops.  Too crisp going down.  Needs to be wetter.  Not the best.
Growler from imadeadguy.  Pours brownish redish.  No lacing.  Smells fruity and fresh.  Very crisp IPA, bitter going down.  Taste is piney and tart.  A very sharp IPA.
Tap the North Fresno location.  Pours a burnt orange color.  Nose is hops and citrus.  Taste is pine and has a sharp bit going down.  Good.

Boring not very good, but just about all that fresno has to offer.  Picked up a 12 pack hoping for something better but didnt get it.  Pours amber with white head.  Has hardly any flavor on the nose and going down.  Not recommended to others.  Another boring beer to add to the list.

Damn this is a beauty, thanks Tim (LagunitasFan) for the growler.  When I cracked the swingtop the room filled with aromas of grapefruit and plums.  My god what a treat had about a quarter inch of head that I buried my nose into.  Taste is incredibly smooth with no alcohol burn at 11%.  Got hints of wine going down, but very mild nothing overpowering with the wine aging.  Ive had other beers aged in wine barrels that tasted terrible, this was done just right.  Other flavors were the malt, plum,  pine, and no hops really.  The beer is pretty thick, really really good.  Drank the whole growler....
beer_name: Stone Old Guardian - Red Wine Barrel

review_blob: Pours the color of apple juice with hardly any head.  Taste was lemon and nectar.  Smell was fresh cut grass.  Ive had better.

Well thanks to Nick AKA "Crosling".  This beer is a monster, heavy bourbon flavors all around.  Right when the seal broke smells of whiskey and alcohol burned my nostrils.  This one got me pumped since I love bourbon.  Poured dark brown and plenty of dark tan head.  Taste was mainly carmel and sugar up front then a strong blast bourbon and wood on the finish.  Each drink left me wanting more.  I did not share this bad boy with anyone; damn Im greedy.  It had me walking funny thats for sure.  I enjoyed this more than the BA Nummer.
beer_name: Great Divide Old Ruffian - Barrel Aged

review_blob: Fuck yea.  This beer rocks, the best tall can Ive ever had.  Pours reddish orange color with a ton of egg shelled colored head.  There was a serious blast of pine and citrus when I cracked the can.  Taste was hoppy and fresh with a nice aftertaste.  Was not dry like some IPAs but very smooth and wet.  Extremely refreshing brew, I wish I could pick this one up everyweekend.  One of the best session beers out there.

Eh, poured dark with quarter inch of tan head.  Lots of lacing left on pint glass as you drink it.  Aroma is malt and peanuts.  Taste is sharp and crisp, leaving a dry after taste.  Taste characters are sugar, smoke, and dry dark fruit.  Not the best.  Just decent

Extremely funky in a good way.  Never tasted a brew like this.  Pours a deep brown with brown head.  Taste is mainly alcohol and wood.  Has some vanilla, butterscotch, peanut brittle, carmel, and roasted malt flavors.  Has a different flavor with every sip especially as it warms.  Highly recommended.

I really dont know how to rate this one.  If you want to get fucked up quick drink this one, because there is no alcohol flavor to it.  It actually has no flavor of anything resembling a barley wine.  Very strange beer, doesnt taste bad, but doesnt have a taste to compare to?  Almost like drinking 10% water that is thicker than normal.  Very strange, could probably beer bong or shotgun this beer no problem.  Easy drinker, just no flavor.  Recommended!
22ozr.  Pours hazy amber color with creamy egg shell colored head.  Extremely bitter and somewhat dry. Ill take the hopsickle anyday over this.  Good, but not great.
Not at all bold enough.  Watered down, a little too boring.  My mom enjoyed this beer, and she drinks corona......disappointing for a Scotch ale.
Awesome.  One of the best DIPAs out there.  Piney, refreshing, tart, and hopped out of this world.  A really really  really good DIPA will buy this again, hopslam watch out!
beer_name: Moylans Hopsickle Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: Thanks Tim (Lagunitasfan)!  Pours a light amber color with egg shell colored head.  Hops came pouring out of this and filled the room with fresh pine.  Taste is hops, citrus, and bubbly going down.  Very refreshing beer, extremely bitter just right for a DIPA.  This stuff is really good.  Glad I was about to try it.

05 version on tap.  Poured hazy amber color with small bubbly off white head.  Taste was carmel and alcohol.  Not too strong, just right.  Very smooth and refreshing.  I cant believe there is a beer this good only a couple miles away.  Very highly recommended!  One more thing.....Won Silver medal at the California State Fair.
beer_name: Full Circle Bad Ass Barley Wine

review_blob: Holy shit!  I found a gem in the middle of the Fresno ghetto!  I am really stoked because the head brewmaster Bill takes aging very serious.  This was an 06 on tap!!!!!  For a small brewery this guy knows what is good for a beer.  Time in the fuckin dark!  California brewers watch out.  This RIS is fuckin insane.  No joke probably the 2nd best RIS Ive ever had.  Poured dark with an eight of an inch of brown head.  Nose was toasted marshmellow and coffee.  Taste was incredibly smooth and easy drinking.  As it warmed it got better and better.  Got a ton of coffee and was really really wet on the finish.  Very full bodied and thick.  A little too pricey is the only downfall.

On tap in vegas 4 Queens on the Old Strip: Poured a hazy gold color.  Smell is pine and citrus.  Taste is sweet carmel and hops.  A little dry going down, but still very refreshing.  The best one they had on tap at the time.  Little too pricey as well.

2007 Bottle #365  Thanks to Lagunitasfan for this Christmas present!  Drank it in my suite in Vegas and what an amazing beer.  Poured dark brown with plenty of egg shell colored head.  Taste was mainly alcohol and dark fruit.  I really enjoyed this masterpiece from Alesmith.  Quite a lovely BW very highly recommended to any who can get there hands on some.
beer_name: AleSmith Old Numbskull - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: UPDATED: JAN 4, 2009
Alcohol is hidden well in this, very smooth drinker.  Shared by imadeadguy once again.  Pour dark with white half inch head.  Taste is slight bourbon, malt and expresso.  Solid beer.
beer_name: Schlafly Reserve Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout

review_blob: 07 vintage bomber shared w/imadeadguy.  Poured black w/tan head of course.  Huge blast of malt and chocolate in this one.  Very bitter but in a good way. Nose is sweet with tons of rich mocha flavors filling the nostrils.  Great beer for the price.  Very highly recommended for anyone who can get this locally.
beer_name: Smuttynose Big Beer Series: Imperial Stout

review_blob: Looking back on old notes.  Drank this one shared by my boss at work while on the clock.  Thanks Mike!  Quarter inch off white head.  Nose is dark fruit and sugar.  Taste is heavy malt and mocha.  Good solid beer from great divide.

I got some soy sauce smell right when I opened it.  Somewhat dry finish also.  12oz bottle poured flat black in my plastic cup.  Very slow sipper, chocolate, roasted/burnt malt, and coffee were the majority of the flavors pulled from this.  Recommended.

Shared by AdamJohn.  Kind man he is breaking this out.  Thanks dude!  Wasnt the most impressive stout, but drinkable.  It pours a lighter shade of black than most.  White head with a burnt coffee flavor.  Not too tastey, slightly overated I think..
One of my favorite impys.  Classic can full of chocolate and coffee flavors.  Pours darker than used baby dipers.  Tons of malt on the nose.  Great beer for winter drinking.  Sipper.
Bomber had this too many times and never gets old.  Pours pitch black with tan head.  Nose is coffee and dark fruit.  Flavor is chocolate and expresso.  Nice beer, recommended.

Smooth and fresh.  This beer is not as bold as the Pliny, but still very solid.  Pine, citrus and hops came out of this bad boy.  This beer is much more dry compared to the Pliny, drank this one right after the Pliny.  Great overall beer.

12oz can picked up a 6er today at the BevMo on Blackston Ave. in Fresno.  This stuff rocks very easy drinking IPA.  The taste is very tart and somewhat dry on the aftertaste.  Has a very powerful aroma of hops and pine.  The beer is somewhat sweet so more than a few of these would be tough to drink.  Good solid beer, recommended.
Pours black w/tan head.  Aroma is dark fruit and coffee.  Taste is all roasted malt with a touch of coffee.  Thanks to WeeHeavySD for this one!

imadeadguy shared this rare 22oz gem.  Refreshing beer loaded with fresh grassy hops.  Has a very full body, and is not like most IIPAs that leave a dry aftertaste.  Super bitter and tart, but not dry amazing beer.  I need a growler of this now, because the 22s are too hard to come by.
Yum!  Pine, citrus, and hops all slammed into one delicious bottle.  Its the next best thing to Hopslam.  Bells makes a damn good IPA.  Go get yourself some!

This beer is classic, can be picked up anywhere for dirt cheap.  Having a bad day? Crack this arrogant bastard and your day will be saved.  Love this fuckin beer, always a good choice.  ****100th rating****

This beer is a little over the top for me.  The alcohol is too dominate for this beer.  Needs more character to the tastebuds.  Where is the carmel and chocolate?  The ABV kicks this beers ass, after a couple of these suckers Id be stumbling to bed.  Has a very tarty finish to it.  Poured dark amber almost brown with some funky off white head.  Recommended, but split this 22ozr with someone, to rough for one person.

Great beer, just dont let is warm too much.  Super smooth when ice cold, when the temp rises becomes a serious problem w/this one.  Pine, hops, cirtrus, and tangy peaches are the aroma and taste flavors I pull.  Get this bad boy on tap; fuckin amazing brew from one of the best!

Solid brew.  Great beach beer for the end of summer.  Slightly hoppy and sweet, but blend together well.  Every year this comes out I need to buy it.  Grows on you tremendously, a bit overpriced as well.  Overall decent beer.

Gracias WeeHeavy!  Yellowish body with pleanty of white head.  Nose is pine and taste is all grapefruit for me.  Pure grapefuit with a nice hoppy touch on the tounge before going down.  This is more of a sipping IPA, not a session.  Another solid brew from Stone.
